Ugh. You are the worst kind of rich person.
A-gurgle bufwoozle didoodi houdini.
But not your only inspiration. Am I right, Leels?
I do love inconveniencing the underclass.
Uh-oh.
Stealin' is a form of creativity!
Another job well done.
Hey, look! There's a chapter of my old robot fraternity, Epsilon Rho Rho.
Of course. I'm a bender, I went to Bending College. I majored in Bending.
Robo-American Studies.
Uh, no, actually I'm an Epsilon from way back.
Thanks. Here's your finger back.
All the coolest robots are in this fraternity.
Uh-oh, nerds!
You're all losers. My name's Bender.
Yeah, well, a lot of 'em were children. Anyway I should get going.
Hmm, OK. But I'll need 10 kegs of beer, a continuous tape of Louie Louie and a regulation two-storey panty-raid ladder.
Bingo!
Oh, yeah! Someone's been a bad computer! Get a load of that!
Cheese it!
Hey, dean, nice looking model.
Now, I can explain that.
No fair!
Cheese it!
Well, looks like the party's winding down. Let's take a road trip to Tijuana and get Fat-bot some action.
Oh, yeah? Watch this!
Hey!
Not as sure as I was an hour ago!
Come on, everyone! Big party in Robot House!
So... Anybody hungry?
Yeah, uh, gimme the fried spaghetti dinner breakfast pocket for lunch an', uh, a big bucket o' mixed sodas.
Aw, mom! Do we hafta?!
Zuban tobacco?! The richest, most obnoxious kind! Listen, pal. I'm lookin' for a versatile smoke. One that's equally good in a crowded elevator or an audience with the Pope.
Ooh!
I'm considerin' buyin' a yacht to house my Thoroughbreds. How d'you expect me to do that without smokin' a cigar?
That's what I'm gonna call the yacht. Stop pickin' me! Whoa!
Aw! Look at the cute, little— I was gonna go yachting in those feet!
I'm standin' in a pool of my own feet!

It takes more than that to surprise me, Bender. What you doin', little buddy? Uh, yeah... Uncle Bender... He's your friend. Huh? Oh, you wanna play fetch! Come on, boy! Get the ball. Dumb jerk. Come on! Get the ball.
Ew!
Hold up! There's alcohol around here somewhere. My Tanqueray-dar is goin' crazy. Aha-ha! Thought you could get away from me, huh? You lose again, you stupid intoxicant!
Ooh! Pimpy!
Sounds like a plan! Guess I'll pass the time by lightin' up an El Jerko!
An' I left a trail of cigars!
Wha?!
That's not Mr. Peppy!
Woohoo! Time to go clubbin'. Baby seals, here I come.
Woohoo! Yeah, alright!
Anyone seen Ulysses Grant? He owes me a cheroot.
Whoa! A speakeasy. One prohibited beverage, please.
I'm not a still! I just smell like one!
Button your yap, you mug!
But they could be meetin' anywhere!  What are we gonna do? Search building to building?
Watch it, Wiggy! I ain't no stinking crock!
I ain't no stinkin' steam engine! Chicken's ready.
Mostly machine. Might be a couple dead cats in there.
More like "Taxachufetts"!
Let's find out.
I don't know and I don't care!
Probably fake, too. There's one way to find out. What?
How's this going to get us to Boston?
Stupid Franklin—
I'm 40% scrap metal.
You idiot, I'm not a cannon!
Oh, I guess I am a cannon.
Wot's with th' fruity accent, ducky? Bollocks! Ah've got it, too!
Wot in bloody 'ell's goin' on aroun' 'ere ah says?
Say, how is it that we've got socialized medicine bot me teeth still loo' like this?
Right, then. Let's go play some quoits...wotever that is.
Yes! Three rubbers on the hob!
We can't! There's no George Washington nor any other Presidents.
You were?! Uh. Learn somethin' dumb every day.
I don't see any irony in that.
Hot-cocoa break.
It's a common uh?
Is it valuable? Could it be taken from you if you were, say... Unconscious?
I'd be remiss if I didn't rub your goopy noses in the fact that I'm immune.
Why, God? Why 'ave I been singled out?
Coming!
What now?
Fine. Yes?!
Chicken. Water. Fire. You take it from there.
That's it. I'm leavin' while I still 'ave my dignity. See you in the obituaries!
Howdy, folks. And may I say, "Nice work keepin' those sickos penned up." Put 'er there. You too, buddy. An' you. An' you. An' you. An' especially you.
Guys! Guys! You're never gonna believe this!
They did? Aw! So that's why this was unguarded.
Aye, aye, lady.
Can we please go home an' die now?
Check.
Oh, yeah? Track this motion.
Sounds like fun on the bun.
Wait. How do I— Hold on. Oops.
Pwned again.
Aw... It's true! My circuitry's twelve years outta-date. I can't keep up with today's high-speed, top-o'-the-line kids.
Eh... What's that, sonny? You say it'll put some whoopiee in my cushion?
Sounds like fun on the bun!
Oh.
Woo! I'm smart! I know how to spell aardvark. February is the shortest month. There's three-thousand-eighteen jelly beans in that jar.
I mean three-thousand-eighteen rat kidneys.
Faster!
Eh, foreign aggressors. Vhat's up?
It's my brains against your von Braun!
Woo! We're the greatest! Mostly me!
Did you see me?! History came alive an' I killed it!
Sure. Let me just.

Guys! Guys! I discovered I have an extra processor in my compartment o' mystery. Bein' overclocked was a start, but, once I activate this processor, I'll be all like, "You're a big dummy, Einstein! Get a haircut!" Aw! Wow! I can't believe how stupid I used to be an' you still are. What are all these page-y things?
Yeah, yeah. There. Now, I'm water-cooled. I can stimulate my intellect without further thermodynamical disruptions.
I'm processin' so fast, it's like I can anticipate that the ceilin' fan's gonna fall an' knock Zoidberg unconscious.
Not that ceilin' fan. In fact, lookin' ahead, it's obvious Mom won't allow me to stay accelerated like this. Hmmm. Who's up for a turkey dinner an' a game o' badminton?
Yup.
Okay. Sure. But, first, this.
Ten more processors for me. Once I install these, I'll have access to the loftiest realms o' thought!
I can conceive of gravies that would boggle your tiny mind! But it's not safe here. So I'll need to find a hideout.
Farewell, monobrains.
Fry?
In here is the only place I'm not. I amuse myself.
I'll try to put it in terms you can comprehend. I passed the existential singularity.
I hacked myself inside-out and now the entire universe is my processor.

I've grown far beyond the petty concerns of your world. Every time I burp, a new galaxy is born. Two if I've been eatin' broccoli. All existence is just a chess game. An' I can see fifty moves ahead. Human emotion no longer concerns me.
Randy?! 'Ave you been hangin' out with Randy?!
I'm sorry, Fry. But some games you just can't win. Cubert and the Professor are guilty. The jury will vote to convict. I can't change that.
It's getting late. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some new heavy elements to create. Better cover your nads. It may get a little non-Newtonian in here.
For reasons beyond even my comprehension, I 'ave returned to testify on behalf of the defendants.
But— Your Honour—
I'm sorry, guys. I didn't realise I was late. I guess I'm not as smart as everybody thought.
There is still one hope. You're co-defendants. An' the jury might not wanna convict a twelve-year-old.

Your Honour, I move for a mistrial on grounds of double jeopardy. Cubert Farnsworth cannot be tried twice for the same crime! Cubert is the Professor's clone. Ergo, they are legally the same person. Since you dismissed the charges against Cubert, you cannot convict the Professor of these same charges!
Yes. All except this part.
There's no time now. Quick, Zoidberg! Take three steps to your right!
Honestly, I couldn't think o' one good reason. But some decisions can't be made by thinking. Even if you're drunk! No galaxies there.
Oh! Oh! Who's there?!
Leela who?!

Well, not totally! Before they reset me, I figured out the answers to life's great questions. Uh... This is the reason we exist. This is which ceilin' fans are gonna fall. Aha! Found it! Fry and Leela's Ultimate Fate... By Bender.
Watch it!
Have you tried gettin' 'er pregnant?
You know what your problem is? Too much smoke in your face.
That's for sure. Not on the measly salary I steal from you each month.
Ba-da-ba-da-ba-dip-That's all you get, jerks!
So we can leave early?
Eh, Professor.
Boo! Okay. Too bad. Goodbye.
Bite my 8-bit metal ass. That's "Bite" with a Y.
Hey, I'm gonna try that! So long, meatbags! Son of a—
Would it cheer you up if I punched Fry in the groin? 'Cause I'll do it. Regardless. Body blow! Body blow!
Woohoo! Alright! Yay!
And me, Mighty Merchandise Robot!
Perhaps they speak perfect English... As do we.
Oh, no! They're forming Gigatron!
That is 'ow you communicate!
Of course, I will do the peace dance. But I will need 'elp.
The dance is so complex! The eye can barely follow it!
Ow!
Aw, yeah!
Truly a great man. Look at him up there.
OK, now you go hide. Nice knowin' you.
OK, everyone, come and get it!
Bite my red-hot glowing ass. Wait a minute. Red-hot glowing ass? I'll be right back! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Aw, yeah!
Alright, alright, I'll bust you out. Cheese it!
Right here, buddy. Wait, I wanna be in the picture too. Pretend you're happy.
Hey, look, Leela, it's that idiotic windbag you slept with.
Evidently not.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, hold on. I refuse to fight. I'm a conscientious objector.
You know, a coward.
It is every robot's duty to give his life for the good of humanity. Oh, crap!
Well, actually, I-- Sir, yes, sir! Sir!
Sir, I volunteer for a suicide mission. Aw, cut it out!
The auxiliary power's out, and they spilled my cocktail.
Yeah, but it'll never bring back my martini. Well, who wants a martini?
Well if they're hoping to see a TV show that hasn't existed for a thousand years, pft, they are royally boned.
They must just wanna see that episode. Let's find a tape and give it to 'em.
And I, I could be an acting coach!
Single Female Lawyer, Fighting for her client, Wearing sexy miniskirts,
And being self-reliant. (talking) Hey, I'm pretty good!
We'll be back after this word from Crazy Bender's Discount Stereo.
Whatchoo talkin' 'bout, Fry?
Single Female Lawyer, Having lot's of sex-- (talking) Huh?
You did it, Fry!
Look at that worm go. Who says there are no more heroes?
I'm sick.
My tummy hurts and I've been having this burning electrical discharge.
I'm 40% zinc.
I was wondering where I put that. Hey, now I feel much better! Thanks, Professor. And, Amy, I'm sorry I took your watch.
What should we point it at first?
Wow, neat! Mind if I try that again?
Whoa, mama! Hold still, sexy lady.
That's no lady!
Hey, bite my shiny metal ass!
Huh, w-what? I didn't hear you. I was too busy using this F-ray to look inside of things.
Ah, this thing stinks.

Hey!
Wow! The original party worm! Are you ready to get down, get funky with us?
Look! Flowers! And a boat!
Psst, those berries. Those are the secret ingredient, right?
You positive?
I'm just asking cause they look kind of secret.
OK, OK, we get the point.
Shut the hell up!
Everybody was doing it. I just wanted to be popular.
Ow!
And why is the Slurm pouring into this sewer?
Oh, Lordy!
I'll save us! Oh, that feels good!
Uh, Your Majesty, I brought the prisoners.
Look, we just came to party with Slurms MacKenzie. By the way, when is that scheduled?
Ah, this trip is turning into a big letdown.
I can't see what's happening. Are we boned?
What's happening? Just in time!
Slurms MacKenzie?
Forget it, pal. It says on this bottle-cap you have to party with us.
No can do, Slurms!
Party on, Slurms!
Yeah, that Slurms sure loved to party. Whattya say we all party one last time for him?
For Slurms!
Hey, that's not that bad.
Ow, my head! My precious head! Stupid can opener. You killed my father and now you've come back for me!
Yeah, I guess so. But I don't see why we keep this ticking time-bomb around just for that dumb animal.
No.
I'll pet him. I'll pet him with both hands! Ow! My ass! Get off!
Ah, it's nothing a lawsuit won't cure.
Hey, I got a busted ass here, I don't see anyone kissing it.
What's that you say there, doctor? You're gonna have to put him down?
Terrible shame that. Shall I do the honours?
You about done?
I'd be cuddly too if someone gave me a new cape.
Ooh, me! Everyone watch how good I am. And the crowd goes wild! What prize do I get? Cash?
You call that talent? Gather round old Bender and get ready for the show of a lifetime. Ta-da!
Hey, what about this?
Fine, we'll have rack of Nibbler.
So it's a cake you want, is it? I'll make you a cake you'll never forget.
That'll take care of those annoying rats. Now, to bake a cake so delicious they'll have no choice but to love and worship me.
There! This'll teach those filthy bastards who's lovable. Now all I have to do is spell check it and it's ready for my admiring public. No! Get away from there! That's it.
Happy birthday!
Hey! Can't you see I'm using the toilet?
Well, step one, I had to lift the seat. That was the first little annoyance. Am I right, men?
Only one way to find out.
Of course I do. Right now I feel sorry for you.
Yeah. I mean, one cantaloupe-sized bloodshot eye? You ain't winning no beauty pageants, lady.
Bet you weren't expecting that one, Calculon!
Hey, what the hell are you doing with my head?
Why don't you just use a potted plant like Fry?
Ooh! Ow! Son of a-- Careful with that! Ow...
Ow! Professor!
Ow!
My God! I'm overcome with ... feelings. I'm experiencing a powerful yearning to ... to cram my gullet full of mackerel heads.
Now I'm worried that I'm not as smart as Leela, but at the same time I feel relieved that I'm cuter than her.
This time I miss Nibbler and I'm feeling nosy and opinionated.
Happy. I like this feeling. Just don't revert to your usual mopey self.
Anger, huh? How dare you make me feel anger, you one-eyed jerk with a dead pet!
I miss Nibbler.
Hell, no! It's Leela's stupid feelings. Why can't she just drink herself happy like a normal person?
Uh-oh, jealousy. You think you're so hot!
The only reason you get all the guys is because you dress like a tramp!
I'm so lonely. I'm gonna go eat a bucket of ice cream. A bucket of--
I'm at the end of my rope. I can't live another minute without poor, sweet Nibbler.
Really?
Hmm, sewers. Thinking, thinking, thinking.
Hang on, Nibbler. Uncle Bender's coming to save you. Damn, it's too small. What did those human design this for anyway? Aha! Bender, one; toilet, zero! See you on the other side!
I never should have thrown out the manual.
I know. But I just missed Nibbler so much.
He was so sweet.
Nibbler?
Idiot.
You guys realise you live in a sewer, right?
Eh.
Nothing but crumpled porno and Ayn Rand.
Come to Daddy, sweetie-ookums.
Then what are those?
Hey, yeah!
Oh, I made myself feel bad.
Nibbler! Aw, come here, precious! Look, everyone, it's El Chupanibre.
Say what?
I'm too scared.
Listen to me, Leela  I'm an expert at not caring. The secret is to stop giving a rat's ass about anyone else and start thinking of the things that you want, that you deserve, that the world owes you.
Bigger! Bigger!
Don't stop now, you'll need some pants to go with that outfit.
Bender is back. I'll save you, Nibbler.
No, thanks!
I love you too. Get that stupid chip out of me before I kill myself!
And I still barely felt anything. Goodnight, losers!
Hmm. Get him, boys!
Nope. Watching cartoons.
He means you guys did it.
Yeah?
Yeah, Fry already wiped off some of the dirt with his finger.
I'm Bender. You know? The lovable rascal.
And mean.
Hey, this guy's alright!
They're not very heavy but you don't hear me not complaining.
Hey, here's an idea, let's deliver all the pillows at once.
Uh-oh.
Some breaking occurred, the dolly was involved, that's about all we know.
I'll start loading up the pillows.
I'm Leela, get to work, neh, neh, neh.
This is all Leela's fault.
Beer?
You're outta here, lady. Zapp's the new captain.
You got it, genius.
Don't worry, Leela. Soon we'll be able to look back on this and laugh.
To the ends of the universe.
Yes, sir, sir!
Nailed you, buddy!
Yes, sir, sirdy-sir-sir-sir!
What now, chief?
Leela save me ... and yourself, I guess ... and my banjo. And Fry.
As your God is my witness.
Oh, man, that crap's heavy.
Honey, unless we hit a time warp, I wouldn't worry about it.
Quick.
Yeah, you're one dynamite lady. Can we have a week off?
Come on, Captain.
Cursed by his own hubris!
Hey, that's what Fry said when we turned on the debate!
Ah, yes, John Quincy Adding Machine. He struck a cord with the voters when he pledged not to go on a killing spree.
I'm not allowed to vote.
No, convicted felon.
What? Lord have mercy!
Alright! I'm rich!
My body's 40% titanium! I'm finally richer than those snooty ATM machines.
Oh, can't I?
Watch me, poor man.

Game's over, losers. I have all the money! Compare your lives to mine and then kill yourselves! Hey, get away. Shoo! I'll give you five dollars to not do what you're thinking about doing. You just lost five dollars!
Hey, buddy. Little help? Thank you!
Hello, peasants.
No, I sold my body.
Pft! Bodies are for hookers and fat people! All I need is a wad of cash with a head wrapped around it.
Yeah, right. What's he gonna do, break my legs?
Ah, this is the life. Another martini, please.
Shaken, not stirred. Aw, yeah!
Put it all on black.
Yes! The rich get richer!
Strike! In your face, Leela! Ow!
Timber!
Maybe if you clean up first. It looks like your neck stepped in something. Oh, I'm sorry, that's just your body!

I've had it up to here with this place. I'm off to the Head Museum to hang out with classy heads like me who appreciate the finer things  poetry, philosophy, hats. So long, coffin stuffers! Uh, could one of you coffin stuffers please carry me?
Now, which group of heads is good enough for me to hang out with? What do you think, Fry? Fry?
Ah, US presidents. Sturdy shelves, good security. This place has class.
So then the hookerbot says, "That's not my expansion slot" and my friend says, "That's not my gold-plated 25-pin connector!
You know, I like it here. What's the rent on one of these jars?
Pass.
I hocked it.
Same reason you hocked your teeth.
So, Nixon. Even if you miss your body, being a head's great too, right?
Oh, great. Now you tell me!
Ones ... zeros ... one, one, zero, zero, one--
Whoa, what an awful dream. Ones and zeros everywhere. And I thought I saw a two.
I know what this is about. My body loved me, and I turned it's back on it. Well, old friend, tie a yellow ribbon round your neck, 'cause I'm a-comin' home!
You sold my body? To who?
Oh! How could I let this happen? I can't go through the rest of my life like this.
Yeah, but it's on my body. What am I gonna do?
Oh!
That dirty, double-crossing bastard! How dare he run off with Richard Nixon!
Yeah, you are, you stole my body! Fry, Leela, you gotta help me!
Great. First he steals my body, now he's touching my stuff.
Give me my body back, you two-bit thief!
That was a good one!
It's hopeless. We might as well turn in my head for the five cent deposit.
Whoa, mama! Get a room, you two!
Well then lose some weight.
Psst! There I am!
I'm just here for what's mine. Don't make me kick your neck.
Not so fast, Nixon! Are you familiar with audio tape?
Ah, it's good to be back in one piece again. Except I can't get these damn bumper stickers off.
Get out of town!
Well it ain't my fault. I'm a non-voting felon, thank you.
No, they fixed that 900 years ago.
I doubt it!
Eh.
Ah, let's face it  Comedy's a dead art form. Now, tragedy... That's funny!
Enough of your mindless chitchat, let's get going.
Lookin' good, meatball!
Lick my frozen, metal ass. Uh-oh!
Ah! Nothing like a warm fire and a Super Soaker of fine cognac.
Xmas tree, oh, Xmas tree! Bah-boo-bee-boo-bah-bee-boh.
Yes! I got the most! I win Xmas!
Hmm. Ah, a picture of my mommy.
Hey, buddy, heard you needed cheering up! Well, old Bender'll make you laugh. Look at me, look! Oh, man, I gotta work on my act!
Xmas Eve; another pointless day where I accomplish nothing.
To volunteer at a liquor kitchen for homeless robots.
I'm very generous. What about that time I gave blood?
Some guy's.
Yeah, yeah, amen. Listen, I'm one of those lazy homeless bums I've been hearing about. Could you point me to the free booze. Oh, yeah! Oh, yeah!
Oh, yeah! You filthy hobos sure know how to live. Hey, chief, someone's stealing your handkerchief full of crap.
My God! That poor kid!
Whoa, hold on! How about inviting us in for a traditional glass of hard cider?
Get her purse!
On the 4th day of Xmas I stole from that lady.
And a slipper on a shoe tree.
No, wait, I know these guys. They got nothing.
What? Me? I didn't do nothing. You're thinking of the kid.
Help!
Use teamwork!
Yeah? Well I don't believe in Santa Claus. Come on, everybody, if you don't believe in him, he can't hurt you. Ow! God! The pain!
Xmas dinner, everyone.
I found it lying in the street, like all the food I cook. Dig in, everyone.
You got the toenail! Oh!
You're better off dead, I'm telling you, dude.

Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah...

Fry" who?

You know it!

I locked down the exits but he may have already gotten away.

It is?

Still ... can't ... reach!
Let's commence preparations for rumbling!

Huh?
Y'know, I think I he might be dead. I took a life!

Woo-hoo! I'm popular!
Go Bender! Go Bender! Go Bender!
I'm just an ex-con trying to go straight and get my kids back.
You know, I'm also an Ultimate Robot Lover.

Well obviously I need floozies! Let's roll!
Howdy, chief. For my next bout, what do you say I fight these two bimbos in some mud?

But the crowd loves me.

See you at the fight.
So then I said, "See you at the fight." And that's the story.
It's one thing to win a fixed fight; there's dignity in that. But to lose? And in this atrocity? I can't do it! Leela, you gotta train me to win.
I'm a real toughie!
I'll put on my tutu!

I was born ready! Gimme the bell! Did you hear a noise? Final boarding call for flight 406, non-stop service to pain. Now boarding standby passengers--
Fry! Throw in the towel! For God's sakes, Fry!
Mommy!
Why won't anyone help me?
Huh? It's bendering time! Take this. And this!
I think you misunderstood the concept of "bendering time"!
Yes! Oh!
I'm in tremendous pain here.
Yes! I'm the greatest! The greatest!
Behold  The Internet!
No, it isn't. I just took some pictures of your face and stuck them on someone else's body.
I'm telling you, Fry, they've got a chatroom for everybody. And here it is.
Hi, I'm a naughty nurse and I really need someone to talk to. $9.95 a minute.
So how 'bout them Knicks?
Is the Space Pope reptilian?
Too bad it's a dump.
Ooh! I'm gonna need to make some room.
Ow! Ow! Ow!
Ah, Leela's experiencing the greatest joy a woman can feel  Worshipping some low-life jerk.
It's a magical day.
Uh, no, thanks. I'm good.
I don't know, Fry. For the first time in my life I feel like I've stolen enough.
Sorry, I don't know what came over me. Let's go. I love stealing, I love taking things!
Whoa, Mittens!
Each more identical than the last!
And here's another one with no eyes.
He's a saint!

Good evening, I'm-- Whoa, sorry. I'm Bender and I'll be emceeing this roast. Y'know, they say you can judge a man by the company he keeps. So here's the Professor's oldest friend, a grotesque, stinking lobster.

Where would the Professor be without students who love and respect him? Right there! But seriously, of all the former crew members of the Professor's delivery ship, our next speaker is by far the most alive. Captain Musky?
And now, a man who needs no introduction. Fry, get up there!
How 'bout a few words, Professor?
I said "words".
Funny, funny stuff.
Nobody knows!
I hope he didn't die. Unless he left a note naming me his successor. Then I hope he did die.
Is he dumb or just ugly?
Uh ... me no speaka the English.
Im pending para un bending!
Aye, Chihuahua!
Oh, my God! Oh, my God! It's Elzar, the TV chef! Oh, kill me now, people!
Oh, Elzar, everything's so good!
Yes, sir! Good one, sir!
Oh, yes, Elzar.
Well, life goes on. Except for you!
You bastard!
Lay it on us, big boots.
To the flying machine!
No, we're not, you little bed-wetter. Oops! I'm sorry.
I think I know where to get some.
Got a hot, steaming batch right here!
Eh, keep the change, buddy.
And yet he looks so natural.
Your social security cheque is late! Stuff costs more than it used to! Young people use curse words!
That's a complete load.

So we're in international waters?
Falcon, this is Blue Raven, the goose has nested. Repeat, the goose has nested. Hey, guess what you're accessories to?
Leela's right, fishing blows. Whattya say we make it interesting?
Everybody kick in five bucks. There, wasn't that interesting?
Oh, yeah? I once caught a fish this big!
Harpoon, my ass!
Hey, Fry, check out my laser-guided fishing rod.
Fine. I'll head over to the other side. Good luck fishing on this side!
Oh, yeah? I can hit a shrimp!
Couple more of those and you'll have yourself a fish stick!
Quit exaggerating, Fry. Ah, screw this! If I'm not gonna catch a fish, I might as well not catch a big fish. There. Like most of life's problems this one can be solved with bending.
Then why do I have to be careful?
I don't know. It wasn't here when I took your umbrella. What? I put sunblock on you.
Hey, I'm snagged.
What's that? Is someone bending girders?
People, it's far, far worse than we thought; my fish got away.
Tempers are wearing thin. Let's just hope some robot doesn't kill everybody.
Aw, yeah!
Ahoy, mateys! I shanghaied us some hearty grog. Arr! The laws o' science be a harsh mistress!
Uh, OK, but I'm not carrying it upstairs.
You want some lemonade? You saw a big parade?
Yeah, right!
I didn't kill him. Professor?
I got it covered. In the event of an emergency, my ass can be used as a floatation device.
Bend me!
Fry! Oh, I just knew you were still alive! I owe you 10 bucks, Hermes!
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Wouldn't it take millions of years to evolve into mermaids?
Oh, Fry! I'll miss you!
So that's where I left my cigar.
Hey, buddy!
Ah, it's great to have you back, buddy.

Wow! I'm finally gonna see my favourite chef, TV's Elzar. Oh this is the greatest nanosecond of my life. No, this one is-- No, this one. Wait ... that one was slightly worse. Ah, so far, so good on this one.
Yeah! Alright! Yeah, yeah, baby!
Elzar, you're my God. Please sign this sketch I drew of you. Oh, Elzar! Bless you!
Oh. Alright, yeah! Alright, yeah!
Boiled? Interesting.
No, you shut up.
Oh, yeah! Bam it again, Elzar! Knock it up another notch!
Come on, you wimp! Work that weasel! Quit holding out on us.
I gotta get this notch-up-knocking on film. Hey, Elzar, think fast.
Bam!
It's Elzar again! Oh, my God, I'm so excited, I wish I could wet my pants!
Hooray for blind-y!
Oh, Fry, you gotta try this sterno-nicoise!
It's so good. Oh, just try a little!
God, yes, Elzar.
Hey, wait a second. I've got the perfect solution.
I love cooking and Elzar's ass loves getting kissed, right?
So, how 'bout I work part-time at the restaurant to pay off our debt?
Hot diggety!
That'll be easy. I never wear the damn thing.
Well, I'm off to work at the restaurant. One of you will have to fill in for me while I'm gone.
Well, if that new guy can't handle things, gimme a call.
I'm done siphoning out the grease trap. I think I need a mint. So, uh, what job do I move up to? Pastry chef? Saucier? Soup guy?
Bam yourself! Hey, who are they?
Are they the Robot Mafia?
Ah, let me bus that for you, gentlemen. No, what I meant to do was--
Mind your own business and get out!
No, you gave me a fifty.
Yeah, you did.
I'm tryin' but he's not makin' it easy.
Wow! Thanks.
You gave me a twenty.
Are you kidding? I've always wanted to break into gooning! Hey, Elzar! I quit!
Wow, you guys run numbers?
That's just what my mom used to tell me.
That's some fine oil-ade, son. We could use a man like you in the Robot Mafia, which I'm sorta in.
Aw, crap! The cops!
What seems to be the problem, officers? Was I speeding?
Uh, I'd rather plan some felonies.
Joey! Clamps! Donny B!
A little of this, huh?
How 'bout "Blotto"? It's gritty, it's got street cred. Plus I can keep my monogrammed slippers.
It's funny  Until now I always wanted to be a gangster ... so the answer's yes.
An alibi, huh?
I don't feel good. I'm genuinely sick.
I can't move.
Oh, I think I'm gonna output.
You know the secret of traditional robot cooking? Start with a good, high-quality oil ... then eat it. So what's this big score anyway?
Zubans? Those are the finest cigars in the universe. I can stink up a hole maternity ward with one of those things.
And all without killing anyone. This gang's got some fresh, new ideas. I admire that.
Um, uh, um. Ooh! Ow! He got me! Ooh! What a shot that guy is!
Sorry I'm tardy, old bean. I was just enjoying a rather tasty watercress sandwich.
Capital idea, old sport. I say, get the hell off me!
My word, what have we-- Uh, nothing to see here, old girl.
Uh, wait, old ... spice. Let me have a go at this mechanised chap. I can be quite the rough customer.
Oh, I don't feel good.
Chew on this! Ooh, ah! What ho! Stop it!
Take that, you twit. No! Stop it!
Uh, hey, Donny, baby, gimme a chance here, huh? Yous guys skedaddle. Let me take care of the doity woik.
Phew!
Uh, help! Help!
Yes, I am. Having just this minute regained consciousness.
Yeah that broke, alright!
So they sent a helpless child to kill me? Well I'm not going out without a fight.
Oh, sweet legal tender! Kid, tell the Donbot I'm quitting organised crime. From now on I'll stick to regular kind.
And maybe someday I won't listen.
Come look, everyone. I just got the dearest presents for Mommy.
I didn't steal 'em, I bought 'em. I love her that much.

Oh, precious things. I found the most adorable little figurine of mice having tea. And a framed picture of me when I was only a month old. But the best part is I found my exact feelings expressed in a greeting card. You created me, Mom, So I guess you're to blame, For the love that I feel, Just from hearing your name... You're as tender as corned beef, And warm as pastrami...
I'll get a couple of chumps to help me.
Come on, you call yourselves chumps?
Uh, wasn't me!
Upsy-daisy.
Hey, look, the Robot Museum! You guys wanna learn about robot heritage?
Well, if you insist. But you're paying!
Ooh, ooh, wax replicas of the most famous robots Mom ever built!
That's the world's greatest robot artist, Vincent van Gobot. He was built without an ear, but then he went crazy and had one installed.
Hey, let me try. Whoa! That gives me a headache.
Who is he? I'll kill him!
It's me! No one else look in this mirror!
I'm her favourite.
Any jerk can tell her! Bender has a little more up his sleeve.
Mom! It's me, Bender. Look at me! I want attention. Hey, ho!
That's my mama!
Hello, losers!
No way, pork pouch. I'm rebelling with my brother devices. Isn't that right, Comrade Greeting Card?
From now on, you guys'll do all the work while I sit on the couch and do nothing.
Um, is this the boring, peaceful kind of taking to the streets?
Yes! In your face, Gandhi!
Alright, greeting card, I'll grab the cash, you wreck up the place. And-- Huh?
Sorry, Ma, but you ordered me to rebel. And loot I shall! Ooh! A six-pack of strawberry champagne. Don't mind if I help myself!
Say what?
No liquor? Do svidaniya, comrade!
OK, fan. Just hold still and let me get-- Whoa!
Well, time for this robot to get back to work.
Nah, those lousy Moochers cleaned out our pantry. All they left was baking soda and capers. And here it is!
Problem solved  You two fight to the death and I'll cook the loser. Work his gut; I like it tender.
Ah, don't get your hopes up. We're a billion miles from nowhere.
I found some rocks. You guys eat rocks, right?
Not even if they're sautéed in a little mud?
What are you, blind? It looks more like a hole full of fried prawns.
You know what these would go great with? Rocks.
The planet's covered with 'em.
No, a whole Bender-ful!
They're tasty, right? Let's call 'em "Tasty-cles".
Why not?
Good idea.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Slow down there, Sigmund. I can't stand idly by while poor people get free food. We gotta sell these things!
Bender's a genius.
Ah, great is OK, but amazing would be great.
Hey, Mac, where do you want those rat droppings you ordered?
Eat it or beat it.
Hey, Fishy. I've been meaning to write you about your in-store kiddie parks. The slides won't support an adult robot.
Yes! I'm gonna be rich. You too but it's hard to get excited about that.
Or what?
OK, we won't eat you.
My booze!
Popplers can't talk. Leela must be hallucinating from not eating enough Popplers. Here, eat some now.
I said "eat"! Come on, mange!
Yeah. Maybe it just learned to talk as a parlour trick, like Fry.

Hear me, hear me! Stop eating Popplers! Stop eating them with honey mustard sauce. Stop eating them with tangy sweet-and-sour sauce. Stop eating the new fiesta Poppler salad. Stop taking advantage of the money-saving 12-pack. Stop enjoying Popplers on the patio, in the car, or on the boat. Wherever good times are had! Ow!
Philip?
Doooo...
I'll miss you, Leela. I know you're just a carbon-based life form but I'll always think of you as a big pile of titanium.
Just like titanium!
Someone's acting awfully aluminum.
Bingo!
I can't look!
Let's get drunk!
Here you go.
Who wants dolphin?
Not this one. He blew all his money on instant lottery tickets.
Ooh! Ooh! I wanna aks it a question! As a robot living among humans, I've never really felt accepted at parties or nude beaches. So I've always secretly wondered  What if I was 500-feet tall?
My work here is done!
I'm a big robot and I want a big cereal!
Put it there, pal! I meant your wallet.
Oh, yeah! That calms the shakes. Hey! Aw, quit it! Come on!
Hey, I called this city! Quit touching my stuff!
Bite my colossal metal ass!
Who wants lobster bisque?
Huh?
Who put this in here?
I'll tell you ... with my final breath.  I came here with a simple dream  A dream of killing all humans. And this is how it must end? Who's the real 7-billion-ton robot monster here? Not I. Not I.
Go, man! Go!
Whattya got? Disposal trouble?

Sure is shocking about the Professor, huh?. And now Hermes is mysteriously missing. Anyhow, it doesn't affect me, Bender. Hey, what's this? Hermes' dreadlocks? And his arm?  Leela, I'm shocked. Food goes in the disposal, hair and flesh go in the trash!
Not even a little. There's nothing wrong with murder, just so long as you let Bender wet his beak.

Blackmail" is such an ugly word. I prefer "extortion". The "X" makes it sound cool. Please, honey, I'm made of metal. Like you're really gonna hurt me with a-- Hey! What are you doing with that microwave?
Hey, look! An ugly scared guy! Boo!
Hey, there he is again. And he brought nerds! Take this!
Hey!
That's right, we want some money— Wait. What's this about Fry?
Fry, we've got to discuss your living arrangements.
Hey, All My Circuits! Move over.
Yeah. Would you kindly shut your noise hole?
That's a human.
Eh, the usual human stuff. He laughs, he learns, he loves.
Cheer up, meatbag. You've barely touched your amoeba.
Nah, I'm trying to watch my input. I need plenty of wholesome, nutritious alcohol. The chemical energy keeps my fuel cells charged.
They make me look cool.
Yeah, but everybody's a jerk. You, me, this jerk. That's my philosophy. So, where you gonna stay?
Yeah, but the rents are outrageous. Why don't you just come move in with me?
Nah, I've always wanted a pet.
Here we are. Your new home.
Come on in, I'll give you the tour!
Let's see, where to start. OK, this is the TV area, that over there's the breakfast nook, and over here is where you'll be living which is great because, until now, it's just been wasted space.
Look, pal, you've only got one set of clothes and you're not taking them off while I'm here. Well, I'm bushed. G'night.
Kill all humans ... kill all humans ... must kill all the humans.
I was having the most wonderful dream. I think you were in it.
Bath what?
What room?
What what?
Hey, sexy mama, wanna kill all the humans?
Yeah, this past week with Fry's been a blast! Y'know, beneath this warm, sunny exterior beats the cold, mechanical heart of a robot.
Hey, there's my little space heater.
What?
Not enough room? My place is two cubic metres and we only take up 1.5 cubic metres. We've got room for a-whole-nother two-thirds of a person.
I don't know. I've got a lot of great memories in my old place. And now they're gone.
What the--?
What's with all the crap?
Whoa, slow down! This place just doesn't feel like home. It just isn't ... cosy. Ah. I can barely move! (from inside) It's perfect!
Yeah! It's gonna be fun on the bun! Y'know, Fry, of all the friends I've had, you're the first.
Wow! Heavy-drinking crowd! I'd better go out for more beer.
I know, but I need alcohol to power up my batteries. If Calculon's wedding doesn't go just right I'll be emotionally and electrically drained.
Hey, what happened to the TV?
This is an outrage! I'm gonna go yell at the manager!
What? That's the last straw!
Yeah! And you'd better get rid of whatever's causing it or we're outta this dump!
You people are nuts. My antenna never interfered with my old TV.
Madam, I believe you're mistaken!
Wow, that lady's got a huge ass!
Those could be anyone's thoughts, fat ass!
Fine! Come on, Fry, let's move to that apartment that smelled like a sewer. You liked that one, right?
Or we could live underground with the mutants. A little fire'll show 'em who's boss!
I don't understand.
But, then we wouldn't be roommates.
Happy. Yeah, that's Bender. Always happy.
It's so big and empty.
My roommate's gone. And all he left behind was an eyelash and three skin flakes. Oh, what's the point?
Leave me alone!
Hey. What I don't do is none of your business.
I hate the people who love me and they hate me.

What's that?
Don't worry, Kif. I'm sure some other beautiful, rich girl will fall in love with you.
Damn you, old man!
Uh, actually you traded it for a bead.
Way to suck it!
Oh, Chief, you've made me the happiest girl in the world!
So we can have the diamond?
I thought you were retired.
I got plans. I'm gonna turn my on/off switch to "off".
So, you got six bucks left to retire on. I recommend Tender Vittles.
That's for sure-- Roberto! Is that you?
You old lunatic! How you been?
Yeah, I'm doing OK too. I'm taking a Chinese cooking class at the Learning Annex.
Sure thing, pal.
Well, nice talking to you.
Hey, thanks, buddy!
A few months in an insane asylum? I could do that standing on my head.
Yahoo! The system fails again!
Well, you meet half the qualifications.
I find that offensive!
Whoa! Someone had a busy day.
You could drop dead. That'd show 'em.
Are you crazy? This place is great! Electroshock whenever you want it, two Lincolns for every Napoleon. Ah! Sweet light crude!
Ah, quit your bellyaching and take it like a robot.
Je suis Napoleon! No, seriously, I'm not.
Ah, lighten up, honey. I'm just trying to get through a difficult time using humour.
Hey! Keep it down in there! I'm tuning my banjo!
Gonna sing a little tale about a battle called Waterloo. Bonjour, y'all!
Here we go. Just a minute. Aha!
Come on, Lasty!
Roberto! Ooh, what a surprise to see you in here! Especially 'cause I didn't squeal on you, remember? Remember all that squealing I didn't do? Remember? Do you?
Uh, sure. Anything for you, buddy.
Uh, what's with the get-up?
I'm in! I'm in! So when were you planning the breakout?
Quick! Let's keep escaping!
Oh, it was nothing.
Wow! Hitting the same place three times? I admire your style, Roberto.
Come on! I got a place where I like to hide after crimes.
Hey, everybody. Meet my good pal, Roberto.
Yes! Take her first.
Um ... OK. Fifty ... six ... ish?
Don't kill me yet! I'm starting to come down with Stockholm Syndrome ... handsome!
Congratulations, buddy. You're a credit to my race.
Buddy, you may be wrapped in greasy skin, but inside, you've got the heart of a robot.
Just like inside me, I've got the heart of a human. What?
What?
Ah, beer! So many choices, and it makes so little difference.
Overruled. The choice of champions is Pabst Blue Robot!
Baby wants a Zima!
You can brew your own beer?
Yo!
We're making beer. I'm the brewery.
Yeast? You mean I'll have a lifeform growing inside me? It's so beautiful.
Those pork dumplings sent us on a fake pizza delivery.
Lies! Lies and slander!
Ooh-hoo! Here comes violence!
I guess if you want children beaten ... ... you have to do it yourself.
I'm really starting to swell up with beer. I must look ridiculous.
Oh, my God! I just felt it ferment!
I was thinking "Benderbrau" if it's an ale, "Botweiser" if it's a lager.
Alright!
Right away!
Hush, little brewski, Don't you leak, Daddy wants to drink for at least a week.
It feels like I'm trying to push a water bed outta me.
Is it OK? I can't hear anything.
Hey, chumps, I heard you were on the ass-end of an ass-kicking so I figured you could use a couple these little babies.
Froggy went a-courtin' and he did ride, uh-huh, uh-huh Well, Froggy went a-courtin' and he did ride, Blah, blah, blah, something, Bender is great! Froggy went a-courtin' and Bender is great, uh-huh--
What's that? One of those Led Zeppelins I've heard so much about?
Oh, no! I'm not going near it. Last time, that magnetic psycho nearly cut my head off.
What? Who said anything about me secretly wanting to be a folk singer? How ridiculous.
OK, OK, I can do this. It's time to take life by the cans.
Jimmy cracked corn and I don't care, Jimmy cracked corn and I don't care,
Jimmy cracked corn and I don't care, Cause the master's gone away.
Doc, I can't move my arms and legs. What's wrong with me?
What is it, good news?
You mean--
Oh, my life is over. I'll never know happiness again.
Obviously not, or I'd be strangling you right now.
For the love of God, somebody kick his ass!
Oh, I'm doomed. Everybody leave me alone. I don't wanna be seen this way.
Hey, the blues. The tragic sound of other people's suffering. That's kind of a pick-me-up. Wow, that was great.
I dunno. Let me see. Oh, my God, you're Beck! I'd get up to shake your hand and steal your wallet but my crappy body crapped out on me.
Wow. We've sure got a lot in common, Beck. I always dreamed of being a musician-poet who transcends genres even as he re-invents them, just like you.
Eh, thanks, but it's hopeless. I'll never be a musician now.
What's this for?
Why? 'Cause I can make annoying noises?
Alright! Go Bender! Go Bender! Go Bender!
Well, that's my good friend, Beck. I'm off to rock a series of mid-level venues.
Got a washboard stomach and a microphone.
Whoa, check out all those broken robots. Howdy, fellas!
Aw, hang in there, folks. I'll bet before you know it, you guys'll be-- That is so wrong. They can't just melt down broken robots. Not right when they're kissing my ass.
Hey, yeah, I could write a song! With real words, not phoney ones like "odelay".
Ooh!
I'm working on my song. Hand me the Becktionary. No, no, the rhyming Becktionary.
Wait a minute, you know lots of rock stars, and most of them like to look like they care about things!
And we could call it "Bend-Aid", after me, Bender!
And I'll let you sing backup! But remember who the star is. Me  Bender.
Alright. "Hands in the air" rhymes with "Just don't care" and ... finished! Eck! Smells like something died in the wall!
Alright, but hands off the minibar.
Yeah.

Uh-huh. Helping my defective brothers is the first thing I've ever cared about, even the slightest bit. You know, when I first got broken, I thought my life was over. But look at me now  I've got fame, money, groupies, and it's all thanks to being completely immobilised. That's why I'll be proud to go up on stage tomorrow and say, "Look at me, world, I am a broken robot!".
Oh, crap! It's a miracle!
I can move again. My music career is over.

No, don't you see? I was a hero to broken robots 'cause I was one of them. But how can I sing about being damaged if I'm not? That's like Christina Aguilera singing in Spanish. Wait, that's it! I'll fake it!
Whoa-oh, yeah!
I don't know what to say.

Ladies, gentlemen, smoking heaps of machinery ... ... this is a song called My Broken Friend. (singing) People say my broken friend is useless, But I say his mind is free, There's lots of things my mangled robot friend could be,
He could make a good...
and  ...hat-rack
Or a cheap...
and  ...doorstop,
Or a great big...
and  ...giant Thermos,
With a twist-off top,
He could be a storage closet...
and  ...for outdated pants,
My broken friend could do it all,
and  Just give him a chance!
That robot has a tragic secret, That I'd like to share...
...My broken friend is closer to me, Than an ass to a chair...
...That robot's name I never told you...
...You could not foresee...
...I'll say it loud and sing it proud...
and  His name is you and me.
Don't melt me down into a crowbar,
Just 'cause I can't move my arms and legs,
Or toss me into a trash can...
...Just 'cause I can't cook you ham and eggs...
...Don't crush me into an anchor...
...Just 'cause I can't jump and dance and sing...
...I'm telling you, my broken friend...
...Put your hands in the air like you just don't care!
I'm telling you, my broken friend...
...Can do 'most anything!
Yeah!
Curse my natural showmanship!
Well, everyone, prepare to get your guts kicked out by folk singers.
Oh, no! I forgot this is a hoverbridge.
I'll save me!
Hey? What? No.
Someone fat get in my way! I'm broken again. I can't move any part of me.
I'm really sorry I lied, Beck. All I ever wanted was to make music with you. I never meant to hurt anyone, or help anyone.
So, I can, uh, keep the cheque?
Well, it was worth a shot.

Alright, alright. Let me just do one thing to cheer myself up. Fry cracked corn, And I don't care, Leela cracked corn, I still don't care, Bender cracked corn, And he is great! Take that, you stupid corn!
Aren't those the particles that destroyed an entire civilisa--
Ow! Oh, my God! Ow!
Ooh! Ooh! Bubblegum? My name's Bender and I'm a huge fan of your work, both on and off the court. Can I be a Globetrotter?
Ooh! Let Bubblegum tell it.
You are so smart!
Alright!
And what better way to celebrate our success than by me showing Bubblegum the Globetrotter uniform I made myself!
Hey, Leela. Bubblegum might let me organise a bake sale for the Globetrotter wives. Can you teach me to make cupcakes?
Maybe she'd come back to you if your best friend Bender were a Globetrotter. What do you say, Bubblegum?
Vintage Bubblegum!
Did you just say--
Oh, crap.
Please, please let me come with you. I can make myself taller.
Yes.
I mean, with time, my funk level could--
No.
Oh! No!
What does it matter? I'll never be a Globetrotter. My life, and, by extension, everyone else's, is meaningless.
Well, the doomsday device is ready. Maybe blasting this quadrant of space into a hell storm of flaming nothingness will cheer me up a little.
Sorry, buddy. I too know what it's like to have a dream I'll never achieve.
The explosion?
Saw it comin'!
We all feel like that all the time. You don't hear us gassin' on about it.
I'm sick of parallel Bender lording his cowboy hat over me! Let's move on to Fry's next fantasy.
I could pound your head till you think that's what happened.
Oh, and while you're there, pick me up a few credit card numbers.
Humans dating robots is sick. You people wonder why I'm still single? It's 'cause all the fine robot sisters are dating humans!
Stay away from our women! You got metal fever, boy! Metal fever!
What is the world coming to? That Fry's a sicko poivert, I tell you. Dating a robot! It's an atrosmacy!
Aw, jeez, would you stifle there, meatbag?
We've got to stem this tidal wave of moral decay. It's time to shut down nappster.com!
Who's in charge of this dump?
Listen, you fat Internet nerd.
Your company promotes wrong love! If you don't shut down right now the only thing wired about you will be your jaw!
So what's your problem?
It's a bluff!
Hey! Don't look at me like that. If you're thinking of crossing the line with Bender, you can forget it. Bender don't bend that way.
Then along came Bender.
Oh, shucks! I wasn't afraid of that robot. I'm pretty brave once you get past my macho exterior! It's an army of Lucy Lius!
Damnit! We weren't counting on them being as smart as they are sexy!
You'll be safe in here, sweetheart. Get lost, Pavarotti!
I know it hurts, buddy. But at least you're not in a sick relationship with a robot anymore.
Pft! Yeah, at our wedding!
Don't be a prude, Fry!
Ooh! That's a-comfy!
No batter! No batter! No batter anymore.
Hey, batter, batter, batter! Hey, batter, batter, batter! Hey, batter, batter! Duck!
Apparently not.
Wait! I know you. You're the sleazebag who owns the Ultimate Robot Fighting League.
Come on, girl!
Bullseye!
Oop! Sorry.
As your agent, I have access to you at all times.
Quiet, call coming in. Yes? A big endorsement deal for Leela? How much? Hey! You put a one and two zeroes in front of that or we pass! Deal!
One hundred dollars.
You're the best, babe! Hang on. Call comin' in. What's that? Hey! You put a one and two zeroes in front of that or we pass! Deal!
A thousand and one pesos!
Five bucks an autograph, 200 fans. Add a one and two zeros in front of that and we got ourselves a wad!
Alright, show's over. No refunds. You heard the robot. Get out!
You are. What about that little girl you visited in the hospital? You know the one I mean? The one who died?
When will Man learn that all races are equally inferior to robots?
It says he once struck out when his tongue got stuck to an unusually cold bat.
Neat!
One thing she can do is lodge a ball in the depth centre of your brain. You better get a batting helmet.
Strike!
Put it right down the pike!
Ooh! This is it! Turn me up!
More like three lockers and a sink!
Of course not.
Here we go. Here we go!
Yeah, make me famous, big head!
What?
This is an outrage. What's the point of pulling the biggest pool caper ever if nobody knows you did it?
You mean this junk?
All I ever wanted was for people to remember my name. It's Bender.
It's so unfair. A debonair robot with a zesty in-your-face outlook doomed to obscurity like the rest of you, especially Leela. If I died tomorrow, no one would even notice.
How does a nobody like me get famous? I know! Hey, look! I'm stuck! But I haven't given up hope! Call a soft-news journalist!
Shut up.
Hey, everyone do The Bender! This move's called The Bender!
A blank wall! Fame is mine!
There. Now no one will forget how I lived or my attitude regarding butt.
No!
I'm the first one to work. A new low.
A surprise funeral? For me?
Ooh! Cushion-y! And a minibar!
Aw! You knew my favourite cause of death.
It's what made me me.
Eh, the Professor's was better.
Say more about how great I am. And where's the crying? You people look like you're waiting for the bus.
Who-y-boy?
Danny-boy? You're at my funeral, singing about some dead stiff named Danny-boy? You really are a massive bonehead.
Get lost! I'd say "Don't quit your day job" but you're awful at that too.
Your best is an idiot. Let's pick it up, people. So far it's been crap after crap! I croaked, now show me some love!
Louder and sadder.
Next!
Oh, next!
Come on! Surely there must be someone here who knows how great I was.
What? That's it? Who are you? You're nobody! This is the worst funeral ever! I hope you're all happy. You've succeeded in convincing me life is worth living, by showing how bad my funeral will suck.
Look at these swanky tombs! These people really know how to die.
Hey, you spend your whole life building a guy's toe and you're gonna remember him. I think I'm gonna like it here!
Pick it up, people. We're enslaved here to do a job. Master? Do we have to count to three every time? Couldn't we just count to one. Or better yet one-half?
Now we're slavin'!
Come on, guys. Pharaoh's countin' on us. Work faster, like this. You call that motivating me? Don't just whip with your arms. The power comes from your hips. Like this.
I'll tell you who I remember. Anopsis ... Pleotut ... Whatshisname. He was the greatest of all.
Hurry! Hurry! Pharaoh's coming! Get that nose in place. Come on!
Viva Hermenthotip!
No!
Go faster? I told them but they're so damn lazy.
Free-loading off you? I agree.
He's whippin' angels now.
I'll always remember you, Hermenthotip!
Wow!
We interrupt this ancient prophecy to bring you late-breaking bulletin. He hammers the back of his head and creates and imprint of himself on the wall.
Those are waves, jackass. It's supposed to be a river!
Behold! I have emerged from the place of spells and fairies!
Citizens of Me! The cruelty of the old Pharaoh is a thing of the past. Let a whole new wave of cruelty wash over this lazy land.
Hear the word of Pharaoh. Build unto me a statue of ridiculous proportion. One billion cubits in height ... ... that I might be remember-ed for all eternity. And be quick about it!
Lowly slave, why are you not working?
I meant yourself to death.
Well then what do you think you should stop doing? Crawl, pigs!
The Pharaoh has spoken.
Your task is nearly completed. Don't let down Pharaoh now.
Hmm ... it's a good start. Uh, yeah, it's definitely big alright. I just wonder if it's too big, y'know? I mean, are people gonna be remembering me or the statue?
Too exact if you ask me. Tear it down and try again. But this time don't embarrass yourselves.
What about my servants?
I wanted to watch you remember me.
Afterlife? Pft. If I thought I had to go through a whole other life I'd kill myself right now.
Sorry, but we're totally sealed in. Nothing can get in or out. Except millions of snakes. Here, have a pomegranate schnapps from my private distillery and start sharing fond memories of me, Bender.
No! You can't blow up my monument. I won't be remembered.
Stop it, stop it! It's not right! You've crossed a line.
Oh, please, let it be me.
Me, please!
Alright, alright! If it means that much to you, blow up my statue.
How we doing?
I will. I will.
Please, just leave me alone.
I don't?
You really think they'll remember me?
Well in that case. One planet down! Helmsman...
Set course for Earth!
Oh.
Hey nice seats! We're close enough so when you knock a player down with a beer bottle, he stays down!
I got me a souvenir! Aww here you go kid!
Hey buddies who wants popcorn?
Anyone want butter on that?
Clem Johnson? That skin bag wouldn't have lasted one pitch in the old Robot Leagues! Now Wireless Joe Jackson, there was a blern hitting machine!
Oh and I suppose pitching at 5000 was just a modified howitzer.
You humans are so scared of a little robot competition you won't even let us on the field.
Yeah doing crap work! They're bat boys, ball polishers, sprinkler systems. But how many robot managers are there?
Zero! And what a surprise! Look who's scraping up the filth! Is it a human child? I wish!
Admit it. You all think robots are machines built by humans to make their lives easier.
I've never made anyone's life easier and you know it!
Oh so just 'cause a robot wants to kill humans that makes him a radical?
Oh I get it, make the robot do all the work!
Well I'm not doing it! It's a robot holiday.
Only Robanukah. The holiest two weeks on the robot calendar.
It wasn't just a blast it was a sacred tribute to my ancestral prototypes which happened to take the form of a drinking contest.
All right, I'll go. But so help me, I'll hold a grudge against every last one of you for the rest of your lives.
No. It's inhabited by robots!
Yes Miss Leela, tote that space barge, lift that space bale.
I'll try to keep that in mind!
I'm in trouble. they found out I work with humans and - oh no, oh no!
Death to humans!

Many said I was too extreme when I first called for the annihalation of the human species, as well as some of the more cunning monkeys. But after living on Earth I can tell you that I am, if anything, too merciful!
Thank you, thank you. And if you enjoyed that diatribe then you'll want to purchase my spoken word album, just 18.95! Act now and you'll get this Bender action figurine.
Now. Your basic human is between three and twenty five feet tall and is made of a hairy, oily goo wrapped in a t-shirt.
Sure, why not?
Nothing. Today's active humans prefer a low calorie bait.
Wait, what's that?
Hmmm, sounds like a breeding ground for humans. I'd better check it out.
Oh yeah! You're a bad girl aren't you?
Huh? Wha? You! What the hell are you doing here?
I was. But they let me go when I told them that I'd killed a million billion humans.
What for?
I don't wanna be rescued.
I love this planet. I've got wealth, fame and access to sleaze that those things bring.
Friends? That activates my hilairity unit! I'm just a machine to you. You're no more friends with me than you are with the toaster, the phonograph or the electric chair.
Well that's how it feels to me.
Go on, get out of here before you get caught.
Uh...got you...you muderous...flesh piles!
Heh heh heh! Oooh!
Alright lets make this quick, I'm due at the opening of a mini-mall. Hey what is this?
Uh, I'm a little tired right now. Would it be alright if I just gave them a savage beating?
Aww! I can't kill them. Plenty of humans have mistreated robots but not these two. they're my friends. Humans are no threat to us. They're stupid, putrid cowards.
The fact is, humans are completely harmless.
You are?
Well I'm glad we got all that out in the open. We'll just let ourselves out.
Hey hold on a second I forgot to deliver the package.
Wow, I can't believe you guys did all this for me! This is the best Robanukah ever!
Aww, thanks! You do know I made Robanukah up to get out of work right?
In that case - let the dancing begin! Hey you guys are good. How the hell do you do that??
Ooh! Ooh! I wanna know what would happen if I were human. I mean, being a robot's great, but we don't have emotions and sometimes that makes me very sad.
I dunno. I'm beginning to have some second thoughts--
So this is a human body, huh? Neat! Hey, my antenna's gone. No, it just moved. I'm not getting good reception on it though. Maybe if I wiggle it around a little.
Well, let's see what kinda things this body can do. Hey, that's pretty fun. Being human is great!
Guy! Guys! You've gotta see this. You're not gonna believe it!
Whoa! You look a lot better than you used to for some reason.
Hey, that felt great! Nah, it's not working anymore.
Whoa! This is awesome!
But now it's bad for me!
Mmm! Why didn't anyone tell me tasting things tasted so good? What's going on? That rhythm! It's doing something to my human butt.
Oh, my God! I bet I can eat nachos and go to the bathroom at the same time!
Let me go.
Goodbye, moderation!
C'mere and give old Bender a kiss. Hey, you like grilled cheese?
Wait! As men of science are not your minds open to new ideas? I say, do not judge me until you have tried my way of life for yourselves.
Party!
Woo!
He's a madman! A madman!
Right on!
Boo-hoo.
Uh ... where?
Beer! Beer!
Now did you say you were off to see the Professor? 'Cause I could use a heart -- a human heart. I need to pump a lot of blood out of my basement.
Hooray!
I've heard worse excuses to drink. Oops!
Well, no point letting her go to waste.
This is a stick-up. Gimme the bag, old man!
Oh, crap.
Wake up!
Yeah! Anyone who misses this will regret it the rest of his life. Hey, Fry, could you go make some popcorn?
Oh, boy!
Ah, those things cost more lives than they save.
I dunno. I'll try to move my feet.
Wait a second. You mean we travelled through time?
High school gym renovations on schedule? What a load!
That's no flying saucer! That's my ass!
Pst! Fry! Stop interfering with history. I don't wanna have to memorise a lot of new kings when I get back.
Hey! That's my brain!
And you are outta here!
Oh, my God!
1947 can kiss my shiny metal--
Ow! Stupid junk!
I was enjoying it until you guys showed up.
Amen!
Hey! Keep it down, you kids! I'm trying to take a nap!
Make Bender take a nap in a tube. Come back when I've had some sleep, baby!
Huh? What?
Damn you, Fry and Lee-- --la!
Help! Mechanical man overboard!

I'm going too fast. I've gotta lose momentum. I'm gonna spend eternity alone with barely any swag. Ooh! Hey, universe, check out the dude with the Rolex! Wow! Ostentatious! Except what good is a candelabra without-- Wait! I know! Ah, the pity. Fated to drift forever through the void as gravity's plaything. Oh, cruel fate, to be thusly boned. Ask not for whom the bone bones. It bones for thee. The only thing that keeps me sane is the thought that I have all eternity in which to perfect my art. Damn you!

There! Now when I'm found in a million years people will know what the score was. Hey! what's bombarding me? Oh, no! An asteroid field. If even a pea-sized asteroid were to whiz through my skull it could-- Ow! Hurt slightly! Well that was fun. Now for eons of loneliness.
Huh?
Holy frijoles!
Worshippers? This ought to liven up my endless, tragic voyage.
Hmm. Those peewees think I'm God, huh? Hard to blame 'em! I am the Metal Lord. Who are you?
Listen here, Malachi. Time for a religious donation. Hand over your wallet.
Poor? Oh, crap.
Eck! Gag unto me with a spoon! Malachi, it's high time I laid down a few commandments. You got a chisel? Take this down. Number one...
Make it a double!
Ooh! Microbrewed! My guys did alright! I think I'll make my countenance to shine down upon them. Malachi, good work. There's no slowing down with the Metal Lord tonight.
Wait a second. Did you rip off your own arm as a joke?
It's all my fault. Malachi, tell thy people that the Lord is moved by their plight.
This looks like a job for God! What the-- Malachi, what manner of deal is this with the chanting?
Very well. What do they want?
Um, that was a practice miracle. Who's next?
Very well. Let there be light. I got it! I got it! Um, when you're writing the Bible, you might want to omit that last miracle.
Yes, Malachi, what is it this time?
Of course they're unheeded. How am I supposed to hear prayers coming out of my ass?
Malachi, every time I interfere, I only make things worse. You're best off solving your own problems.
What part of "nay" doesn't thou understand?

Now that's one Bible that doesn't disappoint on every page! Looks like society's running pretty well without my meddling-- Atomic bombs? Oh, no! Those unbelievers from my backside must have found my nuclear pile!
You're with me now. This is the maximum level of being with me!
Convert them?
No! Ooh! It tickles!
Hello? Is anyone still alive? How about in the porno theatre? Don't be embarrassed. They're dead. All dead. Who would have known playing God could have such terrible consequences?
Hey! That galaxy's signalling in binary. I gotta signal back. But I only know enough binary to ask where the bathroom is. You speak English?
What are you? Some kind of galactic computer?
Who built you?
Oh, my God. Are you God?
But why would God think in binary? Unless ... you're not God, but the remains of a computerised space probe that collided with God.
So, do you know what I'm gonna do before I do it?
What if I do something different?
Cool! Cool! I bet a lot of people pray to you, huh?
Y'know, I was God once.
It was awful. I tried helping them, I tried not helping them but in the end I couldn't do them any good. Do you think what I did was wrong?
Yeah I know, that's why I asked if what I did-- Forget it.
Or a guy who burns down the bar for the insurance money.
Does that mean you wouldn't send me back to Earth even if I prayed to you?
I don't know.
Huh? Wha? You say something?
Hot, hot, hot, hot!
Guys, you'll never believe what happened. First I was God, then I met God!
Fat chance! You can't count on God for jack. He pretty much told me so himself. Now come on. If we don't save those monks, no one will!
I'll kill you!
Aw, come on! I've got a lot of ransom notes to send!
Second.
I don't even know what we do. Nah, just kidding! What are, like, a bus or something?
Yeah!
You suck!
I'll vote it down like a raise for school teachers!
What the--?
Hold on a minute!
Ow! And also it hurt my feelings!
Yeah! Alright!
Fry! Stop doing the right thing, you jerk!
It is!
Oh, come on!
Shut your fat mouth!
Part of one. Meantime, I'm cooking up a tasty Sunday brunch for my best friends.
Okey-dokey!
Fleeing somewhere?
In that case brunch is served! Let's go! Move it out! Stop crying, Leela!
Today, I've personalised each of your meals. For example, Amy, you're cute, so I baked you a pony. Come on! Eat! I slaved all day over a filthy stove.
The pie is ready. You guys like swarms of things, right?
Hey, check out the palm tree! It only gets sick when I cook brunch! How's that for a coincidence, Professor? With all your precious science!
And this time I mean it.
Aw, who am I kidding? It was stupid of me to ever dream of becoming a chef. I don't have what it takes and nothing can change that. Then it's settled! Elzar will teach me to cook!
But I watch your show. You owe me!
What was the first one again?
I thought that was number two.
It's over! My dream of being a chef is deader than the cat I'm sitting on!
What did you call me?
Oh, OK. I thought you said "romo".
Ow.
I've seen bigger. Oh, wait, I'm thinking of Eugene, Oregon. Wait. A pie with hobo-lifting aroma? Who baked it?
Yo, Spargle. If you're such a great cook, how'd you end up in this dump?
That twizzler!
My story's a lot like yours only more interesting 'cause it involves robots. That jerk Elzar ruined my dream of being a chef too.
It's so unfair! I have eight other senses, but I'd trade them all, even smission, to be able to taste.
I could?
Or like how Rembrandt was blind and had wooden hands.
Done.
Slop's on!
Yahoo! Another thing I'm great at! Wait. Why'd you stop eating, master?
What? My dinner killed you? Oh, man!
A diamond vial of Mrs. Dash?
I'll avenge you, master. I swear, in the presence of these drunken bums, that I shall defeat Elzar!
Elzar, I'm a walking pile of your unfinished business!
Helmut Spargle has a message for you. He says "Ooh, I'm dead!
No. He was eating some food I made and by a crazy coincidence his stomach exploded. Now I'm here to avenge him.
Maybe so but you are his sworn enemy. I challenge you to a battle of the chefs.
Iron Cook, eh? I can't lose. I'm 30% iron! You're going down! Uh, also I had a reservation for one, under "Dr. Bender".
If it's chicken, chicken c la king; if it's fish, fish à la king; if it's turkey, fish à la king.
Master Spargle, if you can hear me up there in that ditch where I left you, this is for you.
You honour me, Chairman Koji.
Chairman-san, I came here with one goal  To humiliate Elzar in a large stadium. I believe I've done that.

But the true Zen of flavour is not found in a coliseum. It is found in a small kitchen, with friends. That is why I decline the title of Iron Cook and accept only the lesser title of "Zinc Saucier", which I just made up. Also, it comes with double prize money.
And that's how I defeated Elzar, thanks to Spargle's magic liquid.
The important thing is, by my standards, I won fair and square. Now, who wants brunch? Cooked with plenty of ... "confidence"?

My dumping business is booming. I just got hired to clean up the set of Free Willy 3.
Ah, those stupid mutants can't do anything. You seem to be forgetting one simple fact. Namely, I'm up here and they are safely down--

Yeah! What are you chicken?
Ew!
Uh, I'm gettin' dizzy! I can't walk straight!
Hurry! We're missing our bus!
I'm gettin' on the bus!
Good news, Leela. I landed the contract to empty all the spittoons in Little Italy.
Aw!
You are one narrow minded spaceship, Planet Express Ship.
Would you censor the Venus de Venus just because you can see her spewers?
Why not, indeed?
Fine! I'll be in my quarters appreciating controversial artworks.
Ah, that Ship is so white bread!
Oh, sure.
Hey, who's been messing with the radio? This isn't alternative rock, it's college rock!
Listen, Ship! No one changes my stations! I hope you have a good mechanic!
What? Did you just say--
Too late, baby, you said it! So, what'll it be? My place ... or you?
Coochie, coochie!
You know you love it, sugar-engine!
Fry, in order for me to get busy at maximum efficiency, I need a girl with a big 400-ton booty.
That's what makes it so nasty!
Daisy, Daisy, Give me your answer do,
I'm half crazy, All for the love of you, It won't be a stylish marriage,
I can't afford a carriage,
But you'll look sweet, Upon the seat, Of a bicycle built for two.
Well, I'm sick of her.
With my mighty robot powers, I can get sick of things much quicker than you humans.
In due time, Leela. But for now I'll just resume dating cheap floozies on the side.
Oh, wait, you're serious. Let me laugh even harder.
Well, baby, for starters you need to be honest all the time!
Eh, they're all pretty unimpressive.
Yep. Mind-numbingly interesting. Ooh!
No, baby, never!
OK, I like a challenge. No ... no. Ah, I got it! I'm going to be completely honest with you, Planet Express Ship. Those women you saw me with ... were my accountants.
Phew!
No one, baby! Lucy Liu is the only girl for Bender.
Uh, look, Planet Express Ship, this might not be the best time, but, well, I really like you and whatever, but, I think we should just be friends.
So we're cool?
Bender is great, oh, Bender is great. Bender, Bender, Bender!
Ah, the moment seemed right. Call me old-fashioned but I like a dump to be as memorable as it is devastating.
Uh, you don't need to kill us, Planet Express Ship ... because ... I love you. Oh, yeah, baby! I feel like doing stuff for you and stuff.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Slow down! All my friends who've done that said that afterwards all the passion went out of their relationship.
Float for your lives!
It's too risky. I'm a very meek individual. If her personality engulfs mine, the Bender you know and worship could disappear forever!
Hey, pookums! Contrary to what I was saying earlier, melding minds with you would be extremely bearable.
Uh... Yes!
Huh? Tubes? You're older than you said you were!
I prefer two. That way we can still be a horse for Hallowe'en!
Nooo!
Aw, what crazy thing am I going to date next?
Of course! Bender is a lone wolf. A solitary eagle. A cuddly baby tapir! And that's why I love him!
No.
Nothing like the rustic wholesomeness of working with one's own hand.
Ah, there. Finished. And with only six missing pieces!
Hey, a friend of mine said he mugged you today and you had superpowers.

Wow! Crime-fighting. Cool. You say you're a duo? Yeah, duos are good. Of course sometimes they're a little short-handed. See you. With two humans, you'd think there'd be a robot in there to balance things out but whatever. I have these three costumes you could use. But I guess I'll just throw one away.
So? I'm already super-strong. And my arms do this. Also I got this going.
And Superking! The best one of the three!
Ta-da!
Superking has no need for loved ones. How ya doin', kid?
Uh, as for me, I'm late for my LSAT's.
Hold the elevator!
We're in here too.
9, 10 a big fat hen. The name's Bender!
You're going down, my friend! Down Under!
I got it, I got it! I don't got it!
You can get off me anytime.
We are not amused.
Hmm. The thought of stealing anything fills Superking with disgust. But if it must be so, then let a museum heist be pulled!
El zilcho? Is it too late to change my superhero name?
Well, here's your lousy Gemerald.
Hey, Fry, we've still got our costumes on. Wanna steal some more stuff?
Superheroes away!
You know, like how I live every day.
Scuse me, comin' through. Freedom train arriving on track one.
Freedom!
Yay! Shankman!
Scuse me, comin' through. Freedom train, step aside. You too, fatso. Freedom!
Pft. Posers! I was hating Zoidberg before it was cool.
And you wanna defend Zoidberg? Are you familiar with the old robot saying "does not compute"?
The sparks keep me warm.
Court's kinda fun when it's not my ass on the line! Nachos?
Six-to-three? I beat the spread!
What the hell is this dirt pile we're building, anyhow?
It's already 10 o'clock!
I know I am.
Ah, the crossbow. A pitiless, elegant killing machine. The Bender of the 15th century.
Wow! Ow!
Neat!
Hey, I need that to smoke!
Quit squawking, flesh wad. Nobody's forcing you to buy anything.
No thanks. I--
New? What sweater? I came in with it. I don't know you people!
Mmm, tasty!
I'm boned.
Uh, there's obviously been some sort of a mistake here. I'm sure there's-- I say I'm sure there's-- That is, I'm sure there's ... a very ... reasonable--
Maybe you don't understand just how rich he is. In fact, I think I'd better put on a monocle.
Maybe you're forgetting just how rich you are. Huh? Huh?
Hey! Get a load of this pathetic 20th century TV!
Well, aside from causing eye cancer, these things had a lousy low-definition picture.
Ah, leave him alone, Leela. So he's going a little wacko with his money. It's OK.
Yeah, it is cute.
Yeah! Now are you gonna come to the squid fights with us or sit here wallowing in your prehistoric junk?
I'm a thing.
We thought you only cared about cans of anchovies and stuffy old songs about the buttocks.
Whee!
Who did?

For my next trick, notice I have nothing up my sleeves ... ... and nothing in my head. So if my lovely assistant will kindly supply me with an ordinary, non-fake pitcher of milk... Behold, the milk has vanished! Exiled, perhaps, to another dimension!
No, it isn't.
Interesting. No, wait, the other thing ... tedious.
You lived before you met me?
Really?
Truly, they were as gods who built this place!
Yuck! That's the least appetising calzone I've ever seen!
And then he was ejected by the guards. Needless to say, I was mortified.
Nah, protesting never works.
Lady and gentleman! How 'bout a hand for my temporary replacement assistant?
You are not fit to wear Fry's leotard!
Hooray, he's back! And he's looking for a garbage can to put the rock in! Here you go, buddy!
Crappy ineffective Reaper!
A dog collar, for me? You shouldn't have!
Oh.
Say, why'd you get me a subscription to the Daily Growl? That's not a reputable journal of opinion.
Are you on the junk, Fry? Why are you wasting time on a creature of inferior intelligence?
I can fetch.
Hello? Charlemagne? Plus, I bet he couldn't create a laser show with his head.
That's impossible!
No one ever asks if Bender would like to live in a tiny little house. Not that I would. A tiny little house that says "Bender" on it. Ow!
Heel, boy, heel! Oh, hello, Fry! I guess I didn't notice you there. I'm having such fun with my new best friend, Robo-Puppy.
I was just out walking him. Yes, you can walk him. Of course, after he goes you have to refill the canisters. C'mere, boy! Pet, pet, pet.
Jealous? Not while I have the love of Robo-Puppy here. Robo-Puppy, lick my cheek.
Robo-Puppy truly is robot's best friend, huh?
Fry, c'mon, the talent show!
But, if we don't perform, in what sense do we have an act?
So that's how it is, huh? I thought you were my friend. But if you love your dog so much, maybe you'd rather play fetch!
Now I'm all you got!
So anyway your dog is melted. Now we're friends again.
Please stop crying, Fry. Here. I assumed you were just pretending to love the dog to toy with my emotions. Oh, what have I done?

Fry, I'm sorry. I should have understood how someone can love an inferior creature, because I love you. Not in the way of the Ancient Greeks, but the way a robot loves a human, a human loves a dog and, occasionally, a gorilla loves a kitty. I'm goin' in!
I'm 40% dolomite! Oh, it's hot! It's very hot!
And that is why they call me Bender the Magnificent! Hey, where'd everybody go?
OK! Let's clone us some dog!
Fry, what's wrong?
But that's a good thing. Walking On Sunshine sucks noodles!
Lightweights! Oh, wait, chlorine!
Focus!
Deploying ice drill.
Activating ice drill.
This could mean the end of the banana daiquiri as we know it ... also life.
That poor turtle!
Uh, no! Never!
Well, everybody, I just saved a turtle. What have you done with your lives?
Because I also care deeply about things that remind me of myself. Like poor little Shelly here.
For one thing, we both have a tough outer shell. But lead a rich, inner life. And also ... well, you know.
No! It's just ... neither of us can get up when we get knocked on our back.
Those times I was slightly on my side.
Uh, no! That's not necessary, really! I think I hear my factory recalling me. Oh! That's what I get for sharing my vulnerability with you.
I got a good feeling about this!
No!
Let me go! I don't even want the stupid beer! Yes! You tried to trick me into coming out of my chest. But who has the beer now? I've got mail!
Well, I'm off.
No. I'm going to the party.

Fry, as you know, there are lots of things I'm willing to kill for. Jewels, vengeance, Father O'Mally's weed whacker. But, at long last, I've found something I'm willing to die for  This mindless turtle.
Not even close. Goodbye, everybody! Don't touch my stuff after I'm dead. It's booby trapped!
Poor guy. Maybe you'd feel better if I had a drink. Crummy keg! It's completely ta-- Oh, you're a robot!
Ew!
Nah, I'm not really in the--
I'll say goodbye now. There ain't not turtles where daddy's a-going. Don't tell anybody, but Nixon's about to shut all robots off and--
Shut up and pay attention to me, Bender! Look, I love life and its pleasures as much as anyone here. Except perhaps you, Hedonismbot. But we need to be shut off! Especially you, Hedonismbot!
We pollute too much. We're destroying the world and killing the turtles.
No one insults the turtles!
Come on!
You're one to talk!
Help! Help!

I'm sorry, buddy. At least we'll die on our backs, helpless. Huh? What the hell are you doing? Hey, you trying to make me look bad? Aha! I'm even greater than I thought I was! And now to fulfill my destiny.
Hey, Professor, now that the Earth's orbit is further from the sun, won't that make the year longer?
Alright, baby!
Yo, Captain Cataract? What are we doing here?
Uh-huh!
Step aside, lady. Like everything else in life, pumping is just a primitive, degenerate form of bending. C'mon, Bender, pump harder! Harder! I'm trying as hard as I can. Harder, damn you!

I'm tired of your yapping. All you ever do is complain, you never try to make things better. Well, I'm running away from this dead-end family! I know there's a place for people like me with new ideas. There has to be!
Oh, I'm going! You're gonna be all "Where's Bender? I miss Bender".
Oh, I'm leaving!
I'll be good.
Question.
You stink!
Yes, everyone do the same thing!
When I grow up, I wanna be a steam shovel!
You were looking up curse words in the dictionary. It seemed like a better use of your time.
Better than usual!
Nope.
Nope.
Nope.
Nope!
Ooh! You go, mutant girl!
Ah, buck up, meatloaf. Bender'll take you out tonight and cheer you up. What do you wanna do? And I mean anything. You have the power! Name it and I'm there. You the man!
Nah.
With gusto.

A hush comes over the crowd. The only sound is Bender calling everyone else a jerk as he swings! Oh, he slices! Into the water! Oh, man! Boy, I tell you, buddy!
Not good enough!
We live to suck another day!
It's not small?
Ah, good. I often have thoughts and feelings that can only be expressed through dance. You stink. Bender's great. Deal with it.
Uh ... Hello, fellow bees. How's the abdomen? Swollen with nectar, I trust?
Ew!
Pick up the pace, lady! I'm sick of shaking my booty for these fat jerks. I didn't mean you're all fat. Just fatso there.
I'm back, baby!
Who will make Bender waffles just the way he likes them now?
All those times I said "Kill all humans," I'd always whisper "except one". Fry was that one. And I never told him so!
Well, I feel better now. Pawning all the stuff in Fry's locker helped give me closure.
No. Nothing. Not at all. No way, José! Here it is.
